subject: Re: [junit] Getting VerifyError with Log4J
msgSnippet: Try putting your Log4J stuff at the beginning of the CLASSPATH and see whether that helps. Something in the environment CLASSPATH has another version of Log4J
messageBody:
Try putting your Log4J stuff at the beginning of the CLASSPATH and see whether that helps. Something in the environment CLASSPATH has another version of Log4J in it.

So said berndadamowicz on 3/14/2003 --------------------
Wrote a TestCase for a class which uses Log4J. The following error
occurs when issuing the command:

java -cp
..:$CLASSPATH:../lib/jdom.jar:../lib/javaws.jar:../lib/log4j.jar
de.trivit.messages.TestMsg

..E
Time: 0,121
There was 1 error:
1) testConversion(de.trivit.messages.TestMsg)java.lang.VerifyError:
(class: org/apache/log4j/LogManager, method: <clinit> signature:
()V) Incompatible argument to function
at org.apache.log4j.Logger.getLogger(Logger.java:85)
at de.trivit.messages.Msg.<clinit>(Msg.java:75)
at de.trivit.messages.TestMsg.testConversion(TestMsg.java:24)
at de.trivit.messages.TestMsg.runTest(TestMsg.java:38)
at de.trivit.messages.TestMsg.main(TestMsg.java:47)

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1

This is the code the error occurs this:

static Logger dbg = Logger.getLogger(Msg.class.getName());

This error is reprouducable on every class containing a
Log4j-statement like the one above. Any ideas?

Bernd
